sentences.english: That is the ideological driving force of health-care reform in America.
sentences.chinese: 那是美國醫改的意識形態驅動力。

sentences.english: But the same spending would still be necessary if we were to undo reform.
sentences.chinese: 但是，即便取消醫改，我們同樣要花費這麼多的金錢。

sentences.english: She hopes health care reform will allow her to buy reasonably priced health insurance.
sentences.chinese: 她希望醫改能讓她買到價格公道的醫療保險。

sentences.english: The introduction of the health care system reform scheme has been kept postponed, which gives the public much room for suppositions and conjectures.
sentences.chinese: 醫改方案多次推遲出臺，引起了公衆的衆多聯想。

sentences.english: This is the important part of the new medical reform program.
sentences.chinese: 這也是新醫改方案的重點革新之一。

sentences.english: Congressional Democrats have been the targets of threats and destructive acts following the health care vote.
sentences.chinese: 醫改投票後國會民主黨人成爲恐嚇和威脅的目標。

sentences.english: Medical service and it's market are the focus of all the problems about medical reform.
sentences.chinese: 醫療衛生服務及其市場是醫改中所有問題的歸結點。

sentences.english: The illegitimate bargains on which ObamaCare is premised manifestly fail to meet this standard.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬醫改所作的非法的交易很明顯違反了這一標準。

sentences.english: He also argued that all of Obamacare must be struck down.
sentences.chinese: 同時，他還爭論說整個奧巴馬醫改法案都應被推翻。

sentences.english: The healthcare summit was an object lesson.
sentences.chinese: 醫改峯會就如一堂實物教學課。

sentences.english: PhRMA is spending millions on advertising to support the plan.
sentences.chinese: 該協會斥資上百萬元給醫改計劃做廣告宣傳。

definition: to confer/to consult/to negotiate/to hold a conference
Ministry of Land and Resources (MLR), formed in 1998
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
first draft/to draw up (a first version)
